author: gumb00
content:
Motivation is optimization of DATALOAD - we know the offset at compile time, so we can save on checking it at runtime and make it cheaper.

Issues are caused not by DATALOADN itself, but by the mechanism of immutable constants, that are initialized by constructor and stored in data section.

author: gumb00
content: (issues being - the need to validate deployed code at run-time AFTER constructor initializes immutables and data section is updated)

author: big_tech_sux
content: right, so if we removed DATALOADN, we could have the deploy-time validation of initcode

author: big_tech_sux
content: it seems like we can save 1 gas at the cost of an opcode, and also at the cost of initcode deploy-time validation.
